tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Day Seven Arya and Gendry attend Sansa’s New Year’s Eve party.[[MORE]] To say Arya lacked excitement was an understatement. The...
caption:
Day Seven

Arya and Gendry attend Sansa’s New Year’s Eve party.

To say Arya lacked excitement was an understatement. The time had come for her sister’s annual New Year’s Eve celebration. The party was grand and elegant and everything Arya hated. She would rather go to someone’s backyard bonfire that go stand around in some pretentious evening gown while every person sipped champagne. She had to go though. Over the years her and Sansa have put aside their childlike bickering and replaced it with mutual respect. Their family had gone through too much in the past six years since their parents got into a car crash. All that was left of their family were the Stark children. Robb was seventeen and so was their cousin Jon. Since Robb was old enough to become their care dependant they were able to stick together. They never had to worry about money since their family came from old money. They were part of a group of families that descended from nobility. The other families in town called them all the noble families. A group of several families: the Starks, Targaryens, Tyrells, Tarlys, and the Baratheons. Arya loathed most of the children from the so called noble families. She fit in much better with the other people in town rather than the noble houses.

    There were a few exceptions to the rule though. She enjoyed the company of Gendry Baratheon. Gendry was the half son of Robert Baratheon and acted nothing like his other siblings. Arya couldn’t say they were all bad. Marcella was nice enough and Tommen was so young, but Joffrey was a royal pain in the ass. He strutted around like he was above everyone else and like they needed to cater to every single one of his evil whims.

    Gendry on the other hand always fought for what he wanted; he never left anything up to other people if he had the chance. He understood Arya and appreciated how she never fit the mold either. Together they were able to make it through it all. Well, that was until everyone started to gossip about them. The people in town were spreading nasty rumors about their relationship. They were only ever friends since they were four years apart, but that only added to the drama that the other families tried to create. Those vicious rumors were what lead to the downfall of their friendship. It fell apart slowly. It started with ignoring each other’s text messages and phone calls. Then, they were hanging out less and less. It fell apart completely when Gendry met his ex girlfriend Melisandre. Arya hated her. She was older than Gendry and Arya thought she just wanted to take advantage of him, and that is just what that red-haired witch did. She used him and threw him away like he was nothing. Arya wanted nothing more to be there for him in those moments, but he had thrown her away when Melisandre told him of her dislike for Arya. Gendry apologized to Arya before he broke the news, but how did that make up for him destroying what little friendship they had left. They went for years without speaking to one another. That was until Arya attended the same university as he chose to go to. He was just starting Graduate school when Arya began her freshman year of college. They ran into one another and patched up their friendship as best they could with their past looming over their heads. It would never be the same though not when Arya felt what she did for him. There was constantly this voice in the back of her head questioning what would happen if she finally took that last leap of faith and pressed her lips to his. She wondered if he ever felt the same thing she did. Little did she know Gendry had felt that way for quite a long time. Still, every day it was walking on eggshells from both parties, both worried that one of them would spill their secret. Regardless of their situation they went on with their friendship and made plans to meet at Sansa’s party.

    Arya had to compromise with her sister on her outfit for the party. Arya told her she wasn’t going to wear a dress, and Sansa told her she couldn’t wear her “ratty clothes”. So compromise they did. Arya would not be showing up in a long flowing gown, she would be showing up in a romper that Sansa picked out herself. It was delivered this morning Arya hadn’t even opened the box until right before the party. She was wearing mascara and her hair fell in natural waves around her face. When she opened the unreasonably large box she did smile. It wasn’t one of those flowy rompers you saw at the mall. This romper was designer covered in champagne colored sparkles. Arya did not notice until she put it on just how low the v-neck was. Her cleavage was on full display and she felt so good about how she looked that the thought of being uncomfortable never crossed her mind, not until she walked down the stairs of their estate and into the party. Each and every head turned to look at her as she descended the staircase which made her uncomfortable. When she hit the floor she headed straight for the champagne and quickly put down two flutes. She grabbed a third before walking across the room to where she saw Jon last. Jon and Robb were standing together, Robb’s girlfriend Talisa was leaning against him comfortably.

    “Look what the cat dragged in!” Robb said drunkenly. The whisky in his glass already getting to him. Jon rolled his eyes while Talisa offered Arya a small smile. The small group of outsiders stood and chatted for a while without interruption until Jon looked over her shoulder happily.

    “Gendry!” The two shook hands as Gendry came to stand beside her. He greeted them all before taking a second glance at Arya in disbelief.

    “You look nice.” Was what he came up with. Arya rolled her eyes at the half assed compliment and swallowed what remained in her glass before going to fetch another. She felt him follow her to the table. He grabbed a glass of bourbon and slammed it back, and then another, and another before settling on sipping one more lightly. Arya was now on her sixth glass of champagne and she could feel the booze pumping through her veins. In no time she would be completely and utterly drunk. Her and Gendry returned to their rag-tag group of misfits, both of them feeling the affects of the alcohol within minutes. They would both be lying if they said they knew what was happening around them. Drunk wasn’t the right word for what they were feeling. Confident, bold, lucky those were all better terms for the way they were feeling and acting. No one around them was sober enough to notice what was going on, hells, neither of them were. After a few more drinks they reached unsafe territory where their bodies were acting before their brains. Even more drinks lead to even bolder decisions, both of them throwing caution to the wind. Before they knew it the ball had dropped and their mouths were on each others with a searing passion. Those years of kept secrets finally coming to the surface. The party continued on for hours and the drinks kept coming until both of them were blackout drunk. Only the morning would reveal the true damage of tonight’s affairs.
caption_abstract:
Day Seven

Arya and Gendry attend Sansa’s New Year’s Eve party.

Robb was seventeen and so was their cousin Jon. Since Robb was old enough to become their care dependant they were able to stick together. The other families in town called them all the noble families. A group of several families: the Starks, Targaryens, Tyrells, Tarlys, and the Baratheons. He strutted around like he was above everyone else and like they needed to cater to every single one of his evil whims.

Together they were able to make it through it all. Well, that was until everyone started to gossip about them. The people in town were spreading nasty rumors about their relationship. They were only ever friends since they were four years apart, but that only added to the drama that the other families tried to create. Those vicious rumors were what lead to the downfall of their friendship. It fell apart slowly. It started with ignoring each other’s text messages and phone calls. Then, they were hanging out less and less. It fell apart completely when Gendry met his ex girlfriend Melisandre. Arya hated her. She was older than Gendry and Arya thought she just wanted to take advantage of him, and that is just what that red-haired witch did. She used him and threw him away like he was nothing. Arya wanted nothing more to be there for him in those moments, but he had thrown her away when Melisandre told him of her dislike for Arya. That was until Arya attended the same university as he chose to go to. He was just starting Graduate school when Arya began her freshman year of college. Still, every day it was walking on eggshells from both parties, both worried that one of them would spill their secret. trail.content: S8 better be like this

summary: Sansa Stark In Every Episode: ↳ EASTWATCH
caption:
Sansa Stark In Every Episode:
↳ EASTWATCH

summary: He looked south, and saw the great blue-green rush of the Trident. He saw his father pleading with the king, his face etched...
text: He looked south, and saw the great blue-green rush of the Trident. He saw his father pleading with the king, his face etched with grief. He saw Sansa crying herself to sleep at night, and he saw Arya watching in silence and holding her secrets hard in her heart. There were shadows all around them. One shadow was dark as ash, with the terrible face of a hound. Another was armored like the sun, golden and beautiful. Over them both loomed a giant in armor made of stone, but when he opened his visor, there was nothing inside but darkness and thick black blood.
source:
A Game of Thrones, Bran III

This is part of the visions that Bran has when he’s unconscious after his fall from the Broken Tower. The first part of the vision seems to relate to the events of the Trident that resulted in Lady’s death.

The three shadows surrounding Sansa and Arya are very interesting to me. 

The first shadow with the “terrible face of a hound” most likely refers to Sandor Clegane, called the Hound and whose burned face is indeed terrible to behold.

The second shadow, “armored like the sun, golden and beautiful” could refer to Jaime Lannister who on occasion wears a golden suit of armor decorated with the heraldic lion of the Lannisters. However, there are no lions in this vision but rather a symbolic connection between the gold and the sun.

The third shadow is rather interesting: “a giant made of stone” but with no face beneath his visor, only darkness and black blood. This description seems to hint at the mysterious Kingsguard Ser Robert Strong, who most likely is the zombified remains of Ser Gregor Clegane, the Mountain that Rides.

Sandor Clegane has already played a part in both Sansa’s and Arya’s stories. Jaime Lannister is indirectly playing a role in their stories as well since he tasks Brienne with finding Catelyn Stark’s daughters to keep them safe.

The Mountain/Ser Gregor/Ser Robert has played a part in Arya’s story when she was at Harrenhal but he has yet to play a part in Sansa’s story.

Sandor Clegane has already played a part in both Sansa’s and Arya’s stories. Jaime Lannister is indirectly playing a role in their stories as well since he tasks Brienne with finding Catelyn Stark’s daughters to keep them safe.

summary:
“Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?” 
All she could think of was the lesson Jon had given her. “Stick them with...
text:
“Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?”
All she could think of was the lesson Jon had given her. “Stick them with the point end,” she blurted out.

tags: happy new year in advance guys!

summary: Jaqen H'ghar: Be not afraid, lovely girl. I know we are strangers now, but one day I hope to earn a place in your heart. I hold...
body: Jaqen H'ghar: Be not afraid, lovely girl. I know we are strangers now, but one day I hope to earn a place in your heart. I hold great plans for you, my lady of Stark.

dialogue.name: Jaqen H'ghar
dialogue.label: Jaqen H'ghar:
dialogue.phrase: Be not afraid, lovely girl. I know we are strangers now, but one day I hope to earn a place in your heart. I hold great plans for you, my lady of Stark.

blog.name: thequeenofhades
blog.title: "...then I wake up, like a thief of dreams."
blog.description: Elizabeth. 33. Writer. We are stardust my darling, we have galaxies in our hearts.

title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Pancakes
body:
Sansa winced at the sound of a slammed door and some angry steps and then, another door slam, Arya had lost then.

Sansa knew how excited Arya had been for this tournament, because if things had gone well, Arya might have been in a good position for a place in the Olympic fencing team; but judging by Arya’s anger, things had gone south, well, there’s one thing she could do.

Sansa began making Arya’s favorite pancakes, apple pie ones, her sister needed a pick-me-up and if she couldn’t console her properly, at least she could feed her some of her favorite foods; once she had a good stack, she took four of them and went to Arya’s room.

Sansa opened the door quietly, watching her sister’s figure face down on her bed, “Arya, I got you pancakes - your favorites, I’m going to leave them in your night table.”

“My life has fallen to pieces but these pancakes have always been here for me,“ Arya’s voice reached her before she walked out.

"I love you too Arya,” Her voice was soft as she closed the door behind her.

summary:
All Rivers Lead to the Sea Chapters: 8/? 

Summary: “No, Ned. Arya is not ready to go to King’s Landing.” “It’s time for Arya to...
caption:
All Rivers Lead to the Sea
Chapters: 8/?

Summary:
“No, Ned. Arya is not ready to go to King’s Landing.”
“It’s time for Arya to learn of the Southern Court. She will not be a child forever.”
“I agree, but King’s Landing is not the place for her.”
“Do you have an alternative in mind?”
“If you are so set on having her in the South, i will write my Father. Arya can assist Father, the responsibility will be good for her.”
or Arya goes to Riverrun instead of King’s Landing and surprisingly little changes for everyone else.

Chapter Summary:
Nymeria goes head to head with a shadow, Hoster and Edmure have different ways of motivating, and Arya and Hoster talk about dragons

tags: a song of ice and fire
A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Day Six The Hound has a few too many drinks and goes on and on about what Arya would mutter in her sleep while she was under his...
caption:
Day Six

The Hound has a few too many drinks and goes on and on about what Arya would mutter in her sleep while she was under his protection.

He slammed the cup down on the wood of the head table, completely oblivious of the loathsome glances from the other noblemen and women. He was beyond drunk, and when he was drunk he lost his wits, oftentimes losing complete control of his tongue. He had a tendency of not connecting his brain and his mouth.

    “Gods boy would you stop you moping?” He all but shouted across the table where Gendry sat uncomfortably. “What is it? Do you think if you keep staring at her she’ll give you the time of day? I believe you lost that chance once she sailed across seas to Braavos, if you hadn’t gone with the Red Witch the outcome probably would’ve been different.”

    “What bullshit are you spilling now Clegane?” Jon looked at him with that northern glare. The Hound ignored him completely, still talking directly at the sole Baratheon.

    “Every. Fucking. Night. She would go on and on about you in her sleep. Sometimes crying out your name in sorrow, other times anger, hell pleasure too I’d bet.” He took another gulp of his ale. “She loved you once I’d say, but you threw that all away when you decided to stay with the fucking Brotherhood.”

    Everyone sat there and stared at the Hound, disbelief covered their faces. Every face except Arya’s that is. Her face was shining beet-red from embarrassment. She mustn’t of known what she did in her sleep all those years ago. He had enough sense to feel slightly guilty, but he also felt smug for knowing something she didn’t.

    “What little wolf?” He yelled unabashedly. “Cat got your tongue? Or should I say Hound?”

    Arya lunged for him then, she must’ve been thankful that she chose to wear trousers today, if she hadn’t she wouldn’t have been able to get at him so easily. That Valyrian steel blade was pressed to his throat so face that he didn’t have time to move let alone breathe.

    “You better watch that mouth of yours Clegane before you say something you regret.” Arya pressed the blade a little harsher against the skin of his neck. He snarled at her and was about to pounce when Gendry spoke up.

    “Look, we all know I fucked up.” He said frankly, “No one here need you to remind me how I ruined my own future. I made the wrong decision and now I am going to have to live with that for the rest of my days. Forgive me your Grace, I’m going to retire early.”

    Gendry walked out of the great hall and into the night, but he wasn’t out of earshot before the Hound yelp; “What? Was it something I said?”

    Gendry turned sharply and glared back, fully prepared to speak his mind once more, but he was beat to it when a loud slap rang against the stone walls. Arya had stuck Sandor so hard that he had a cut above his left eye that was slowly dripping blood.

    “Speak one more word against my friend and I’ll make sure that you’ll be bed ridden for a long period of time.” She was seething now, she couldn’t help it. Arya couldn’t bear to watch someone talk down to Gendry about the mistakes he made in his past. She understood why he made them now. At the time he was a bastard boy and her mother and brother would never approve of their relationship, no matter what it was. She was highborn and he was not. She thought his actions were unforgivable, but the horrible things she has done over the years outweighed the choices he made. It mattered not what decisions the two of them made in the past, it was the present and the future was not promised. The God of Death promised nothing to anyone and she would be a fool to believe she had all the time in the world to hold petty grudges.

    “What Gendry did in the past was cruel, but how I treated him was just as awful. We are new people now. For all you know we could be in love. So tell me Clegane, what is it that you think you know.”

“What I know is that you two are both wasting this time you preach about not having enough of. That boy over there worships the ground you walk on, he treats you as some kind of goddess, but you’re too blind to see it. You still hold a grudge over what he did in the past whether you want to admit it or not. Well little wolf, get over it. Pull up your trousers and act like the woman we all know you to be. Stop being scared of something you don’t know the outcome of.” The Hounds words chilled her, but she wouldn’t let him win. She stalked right over to Gendry and grabbed his face, pulling it down to hers. Harshly she pressed her lips against his, at first full of spite and loathing for the Hound, but all thoughts of Sandor Clegane left her mind when she felt his arms snake around her waist. If she heard the cheers of approval she didn’t acknowledge them. Her sole focus was him, and it would be foolish of her to waste more time. Gendry must’ve been thinking the same thing when he let her go. He looked her in the eyes and with all the confidence in the world asked her the few words she never imagined herself saying yes to. “Be mine, now and always.”

“Now and always. From this day until my last day I will be yours Gendry Baratheon and you will be mine.” From across the room Jon’s eyes lowered to the floor and he couldn’t help but think of his first love and those same words she uttered to him so many years ago. He’d be a liar if he said she didn’t haunt his dreams. Jon just hoped that for his sister’s sake she would never suffer the loss of her love. Though he figured she had, but Arya being Arya she was never willing to let go of what she wanted or what she loved. Hell she still had needle. Jon supposed that now she had everything she ever wanted. She was a warrior, one of the best in the Seven Kingdoms, and Gendry would never force her to be a lady. Jon could picture Ned Stark looking at her now and just how proud he would be to see his youngest daughter’s dreams coming true.

Day Six

The Hound has a few too many drinks and goes on and on about what Arya would mutter in her sleep while she was under his protection.

She mustn’t of known what she did in her sleep all those years ago. He had enough sense to feel slightly guilty, but he also felt smug for knowing something she didn’t.

    “What little wolf?” He yelled unabashedly. “Cat got your tongue? Or should I say Hound?”

    Arya lunged for him then, she must’ve been thankful that she chose to wear trousers today, if she hadn’t she wouldn’t have been able to get at him so easily. That Valyrian steel blade was pressed to his throat so face that he didn’t have time to move let alone breathe.

    “You better watch that mouth of yours Clegane before you say something you regret.” Arya pressed the blade a little harsher against the skin of his neck. He snarled at her and was about to pounce when Gendry spoke up.

    “Look, we all know I fucked up.” He said frankly, “No one here need you to remind me how I ruined my own future. I made the wrong decision and now I am going to have to live with that for the rest of my days. Forgive me your Grace, I’m going to retire early.”

    Gendry walked out of the great hall and into the night, but he wasn’t out of earshot before the Hound yelp; “What? Was it something I said?”

    Gendry turned sharply and glared back, fully prepared to speak his mind once more, but he was beat to it when a loud slap rang against the stone walls. Arya had stuck Sandor so hard that he had a cut above his left eye that was slowly dripping blood.

    “Speak one more word against my friend and I’ll make sure that you’ll be bed ridden for a long period of time.” She was seething now, she couldn’t help it. Arya couldn’t bear to watch someone talk down to Gendry about the mistakes he made in his past. She understood why he made them now. At the time he was a bastard boy and her mother and brother would never approve of their relationship, no matter what it was. She was highborn and he was not. She thought his actions were unforgivable, but the horrible things she has done over the years outweighed the choices he made. It mattered not what decisions the two of them made in the past, it was the present and the future was not promised. The God of Death promised nothing to anyone and she would be a fool to believe she had all the time in the world to hold petty grudges.

    “What Gendry did in the past was cruel, but how I treated him was just as awful. We are new people now. For all you know we could be in love. So tell me Clegane, what is it that you think you know.”

“What I know is that you two are both wasting this time you preach about not having enough of. That boy over there worships the ground you walk on, he treats you as some kind of goddess, but you’re too blind to see it. You still hold a grudge over what he did in the past whether you want to admit it or not. Well little wolf, get over it. Pull up your trousers and act like the woman we all know you to be. Stop being scared of something you don’t know the outcome of.” The Hounds words chilled her, but she wouldn’t let him win. She stalked right over to Gendry and grabbed his face, pulling it down to hers. Harshly she pressed her lips against his, at first full of spite and loathing for the Hound, but all thoughts of Sandor Clegane left her mind when she felt his arms snake around her waist. If she heard the cheers of approval she didn’t acknowledge them. Her sole focus was him, and it would be foolish of her to waste more time. Gendry must’ve been thinking the same thing when he let her go. He looked her in the eyes and with all the confidence in the world asked her the few words she never imagined herself saying yes to. “Be mine, now and always.”

“Now and always. From this day until my last day I will be yours Gendry Baratheon and you will be mine.” From across the room Jon’s eyes lowered to the floor and he couldn’t help but think of his first love and those same words she uttered to him so many years ago. He’d be a liar if he said she didn’t haunt his dreams. Jon just hoped that for his sister’s sake she would never suffer the loss of her love. Though he figured she had, but Arya being Arya she was never willing to let go of what she wanted or what she loved. Hell she still had needle. Jon supposed that now she had everything she ever wanted. She was a warrior, one of the best in the Seven Kingdoms, and Gendry would never force her to be a lady. Jon could picture Ned Stark looking at her now and just how proud he would be to see his youngest daughter’s dreams coming true.
trail.content_abstract:
Day Six

The Hound has a few too many drinks and goes on and on about what Arya would mutter in her sleep while she was under his protection.

summary: No point in trying to hide behind that face. I know fear when I see it. Seen it a lot.
